generate

public byte[] generate()

load

public java.lang.ClassLoader load(java.lang.ClassLoader parent,
                                  java.io.File dexOutputDir,
                                  java.io.File dexOptCacheDir)
                           throws java.io.IOException
Loads the generated types into the current process.

All parameters are optional, you may pass null and suitable defaults will be used.

If you opt to provide your own output directories, take care to ensure that they are not world-readable, otherwise a malicious app will be able to inject code to run. A suitable parameter for these output directories would be something like this: getApplicationContext().getDir("dx", Context.MODE_PRIVATE);

Parameters:
parent - the parent ClassLoader to be used when loading our generated types
dexOutputDir - the destination directory wherein we will write emitted .dex files before they end up in the cache directory
dexOptCacheDir - where optimized .dex files are to be written
Throws:
java.io.IOException
